metadata.title: CVE-2021-47194 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:cfg80211: call cfg80211_stop_ap when switch from P2P_GO type If theuserspace tools switch from NL80211_IFTYPE_P2P_GO to NL80211_IFTYPE_ADHOCvia send_msg(NL80211_CMD_SET_INTERFACE), it does not call the cleanupcfg80211_stop_ap(), this leads to the initialization of in-use data. Forexample, this path re-init the sdata->assigned_chanctx_list while it isstill an element of assigned_vifs list, and makes that linked list corrupt.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47194` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-generic - 4.4.0-257.291
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-257-lowlatency - 4.4.0-257.291
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-generic - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-167-lowlatency - 4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-kvm - 4.4.0-1135.145
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1172-aws - 4.4.0-1172.187
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1119-aws - 4.15.0-1119.126~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1130-azure - 4.15.0-1130.143~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-fips - 4.4.0-1103.110
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1103-fips - 4.4.0-1103.110
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1103-fips - 4.4.0-1103.110
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1103-fips - 4.4.0-1103.110
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-gcp - 4.15.0-1115.129~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1086-oracle - 4.15.0-1086.94~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-257.291').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-167.175~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.145').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1172.187').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1119.126~16.04.2').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1130.143~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.110').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.129~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1086.94~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
